column1:
['Here is a structured summary of the discussion:

**Discussion Points/Agenda:**
- The meeting involved the reading and adoption of three proclamations.
- Proclamation 988 series of 2016 was read, proclaiming the week of October 17 through October 21st, 2016, as "Choose to Be Great Week" in Denver, Colorado.
- The proclamation aims to reduce youth violence and bullying while fostering better relationships between youth and law enforcement officers.
- The Gang Resistance Education and Training (GREAT) program is an evidence-based gang and violence prevention program.

**Decisions Made:**
- The City Council adopted Proclamation 988 series of 2016, proclaiming the week of October 17 through October 21st, 2016, as "Choose to Be Great Week" in Denver, Colorado.
- The council encourages all students to be upstanders by speaking up against bullying, wearing orange throughout the week, and signing the GREAT pledge.

**Action Items:**
- The Clerk of the City and County of Denver shall affix the seal of the city and county to the proclamation and transmit copies to relevant parties, including the executive director of the Gang Reduction Initiative of Denver, the Denver Police Department, the Denver Juvenile Probation Department, and the U.S. Attorney's Office.
- Students in Denver public schools will be made aware of the proclamation and will participate in the "Choose to Be Great Week" activities.', 252]
